hero_subtitle: MSc Student in Strategy and Economics at FEA-USP
profile_collab_bubble:
Do you want to collaborate?
Send me an email!
profile_p1: I am a Master's student in Strategy and Economics at the University of São Paulo (USP) (FEA-USP), funded by BNDES. My research interests are economic development, econometrics, and machine learning.
profile_p2: I am currently CEO at Nordaris Partners. I previously served as a Research Assistant at FEA-USP. I hold a B.A. in International Relations (ESPM-SP) and a B.Sc. in Statistics (UFSCar).
profile_p3: Outside of work, I am an avid reader and enjoy sports such as boxing and chess.
profile_contact_p: Feel free to email me for any questions or collaboration opportunities: alison.sousa@usp.br.
research_paper1_citation: Valmor Comim, Gilmar Masiero, Mario Ogasavara, Alison Sousa (2025). Expanding the OLI Approach: The ERP Chinese Model. (Under review at Management and Organization Review)
research_paper4_citation: Alison Sousa, João Neto (2025). AI for Epidemiological Risk Prediction in Brazil. (Under review at Journal of Information and Data Management)
research_paper2_citation: Alison Sousa, João Neto (2025). AI for Epidemiological Risk Prediction in Brazil: A SLR. (Under review at SBC Computing Reviews)
research_paper3_citation: Alison Sousa, Igor Gondim (2022). International diversification via ETFs from the Sharpe ratio perspective. 33rd National Meeting of Administration Graduation Courses.
research_paper1_abstract: This paper explores the expansion of the OLI (Ownership, Location, Internalization) paradigm by integrating the ERP (Entry, Resource-seeking, Platform) Chinese Model framework. We analyze how Chinese multinational enterprises leverage unique strategic advantages in global markets, contributing to international business theory.
research_paper2_abstract: A systematic literature review examining the application of Artificial Intelligence for epidemiological risk prediction in Brazil. We identify key methodologies, datasets, and research gaps in the current body of literature.
research_paper3_abstract: This paper explores international diversification strategies using Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs), with a particular focus on the Sharpe ratio as a performance metric. The study was presented at the 33rd National Meeting of Administration Graduation Courses.
research_paper4_abstract: This research develops an AI-based predictive model for epidemiological risk assessment in Brazil. Using machine learning techniques, we analyze historical data to forecast disease outbreaks and support public health decision-making.
vitae_p1: Below you can access my Curriculum Vitae documents.

news_item2_summary: Ranked 1st in the Statistics admission at UFSCar.
news_item1_summary: Highlight of a technological solution for isolated communities in Brazil.
